data.text: And he brought out of him a merciful man,
He made him like to the glorious saints,
By his words he caused the wonders to cease,
He sanctified him in his faithfulness and meekness,
He made him to hear his voice,
He exalted Aaron, a holy man like unto him,
An everlasting covenant he made with him,
He put upon him perfect glory;
And he compassed him with pomegranates
With a holy garment, with gold, and blue silk,
With twisted scarlet, the work of the cunning workman,
He set a crown of gold upon the miter,
Before him there were none such,
Their sacrifices shall be wholly consumed every day twice continually.
Moses consecrated him, and anointed him with holy oil;
He chose him out of all men living
He gave unto him his commandments,
Strangers conspired together against him,
This the Lord saw, and it displeased him,
But he made Aaron more honorable,
For they eat of the sacrifices of the Lord,
Howbeit in the land of the people he had no inheritance,
The third in glory is Phinehas the son of Eleazar,
Therefore was there a covenant of peace made with him,
According to the covenant made with David son of Jesse, of the tribe of Judah,
God give you wisdom in your heart
